Season 4, Episode 1: The Tooth Fairy's Tats 2000
Original Air Date:5 April 2000
The boys enter the world of organized crime when they realize they can make 
money from the tooth fairy with other children's teeth.

Season 4, Episode 2: Cartman's Silly Hate Crime 2000
Original Air Date:12 April 2000
Cartman is sent to juvenile hall after he throws a rock at a black child.

Season 4, Episode 3: Timmy 2000
Original Air Date:19 April 2000
A handicapped boys' arrival in class leads to protest. Meanwhile, the boys 
are diagnosed with ADD and heavily medicated.

Season 4, Episode 4: Quintuplets 2000
Original Air Date:26 April 2000
The Marshes adopt a group of Romanian Quintuplets after they are orphaned 
in South Park. However, soon the Romanian government demands them back. 
Meanwhile, Kenny develops a talent for singing.

Season 4, Episode 5: Cartman Joins NAMBLA
Original Air Date:21 June 2000
Cartman joins NAMBLA, thinking it will introduce him to more mature friends. 
Meanwhile, Kenny tries to dispose of his unborn baby brother.

Season 4, Episode 6: Cherokee Hair Tampons
Original Air Date:28 June 2000
Kyle needs a kidney transplant, and Cartman is the only suitable donor. 
Meanwhile, Mr. Garrison writes a novel.

Season 4, Episode 7: Chef Goes Nanners
Original Air Date:5 July 2000
Chef protests the racist South Park flag.

Season 4, Episode 8: Something You Can Do with Your Finger
Original Air Date:12 July 2000
Randy is outraged when Stan and the other boys start a boy band.

Season 4, Episode 9: Do the Handicapped Go to Hell?
Original Air Date:19 July 2000
The boys become obsessed with religion after a sermon about hell scares them. 
Meanwhile, Saddam returns to Hell and tries to dispose of Satan's new boyfriend.

Season 4, Episode 10: Probably
Original Air Date:26 July 2000
Cartman becomes an evangelical preacher when the boys break off from their church. 
Meanwhile, the feud between Saddam and Chris continues.

Season 4, Episode 11: 4th Grade
Original Air Date:8 November 2000
The boys deal with a strict new teacher and experiment with time travel as 
Mr. Garrison comes to terms with his sexuality.

Season 4, Episode 12: Trapper Keeper
Original Air Date:15 November 2000
Cartman's new trapper keeper threatens to assimilate the town unless Kyle and 
a robot from the future can stop it.

Season 4, Episode 13: Helen Keller! the Musical
Original Air Date:22 November 2000
Cartman goes overboard directing a Thanksgiving production of "The Miracle Worker." 
Meanwhile, Timmy develops a bond with a runt turkey named Gobbles.

Season 4, Episode 14: Pip
Original Air Date:29 November 2000
Pip attends boarding school in an adaptation of "Great Expectations."

Season 4, Episode 15: Fat Camp
Original Air Date:6 December 2000
Cartman is outraged when he is sent to fat camp by his mother. 
Meanwhile, Kenny becomes famous for a "Jackass" style TV show.

Season 4, Episode 16: The Wacky Molestation Adventure
Original Air Date:13 December 2000
The boys tell the police that their parents molest them and soon there are no 
adults left in South Park. However, without authority figures, society crumbles.

Season 4, Episode 17: A Very Crappy Christmas
Original Air Date:20 December 2000
When everyone in South Park decides to forgo presents and celebrate a 
non-materialistic holiday season, the boys try to bring the spirit of 
commercialism back to Christmas by making an animated film.
